item.title: Applied Modern Distributism
item.description: Within the spectrum of philosophical positions, distributism presents itself as an incredibly valuable economic theory - one in which both the fundamental value and rights of individual humans are focused on as primary tenets. It is this focus, an elevation of the individual among the many, that puts it in direct contrast with the more commonly argued capitalism and socialism. Capitalism maintains free markets and privately-held productive resources while socialism holds resources centrally via the state and regulates market systems.
